title: Digital Sequence Information: An Evidence Review
description:
The Convention on Biological Diversity (CBD) policy team requires a research study to look at feasible options, by which user nations could implement a benefit sharing mechanism for the use of Digital Sequencing Information (DSI).  This need has arisen due to some of the provider countries (which are home to the genetic resource) calling for the benefits to be shared. The requirement to carry out this study has become crucial in enabling a consensus on the subject of DSI and how it is shared.   
The objective of this study is twofold.  Firstly it aims to increase our existing knowledge of DSI, including the financial, social and economic impacts of DSI on a global marketplace.  Secondly, to identify any feasible alternative mechanisms, which could be used to achieve fair and equitable sharing of the benefits.  This opportunity is advertised by DgC on behalf of Core Defra.

title: PBL - 150083 PPC Zones 5 to 8 Reconfiguration Construction
description:
Porton biopharma Ltd are looking for a Principal contractor to procure, construct and commission a 2-phased approach project within their live manufacturing facility. RIBA 4 design information will be available at Invitation to Tender during this procurement process. 

The proposal will reconfigure / refurbish the existing biopharmaceutical manufacturing facility onsite at Porton down, the new arrangement will consist of Grade D & Grade C cleanrooms.  

The project will consist of but not limited to:

1.	Existing black utilities modification & reconfigurations.
2.	Existing clean utilities modification & reconfigurations.
3.	New clean steam, Water for Injection and purified water generation and distribution.
4.	A mixture of client procured and principal contractor procured process equipment integration.
5.	Demolition of existing areas i.e. internal wall, ceilings, all finishes, redundant services and equipment to enable reconfiguration and repurposing of the areas. Plantrooms and service area will also be in scope.
6.	Liaison with PBL appointed designer & execution of contractor’s design portion.
7.	Commissioning of the facility/equipment for handover to PBL to undertake any Qualification that may be required.
8.	 Grade C processing room, cold rooms, storage rooms, with associated change room and material/equipment airlocks. Grade D equipment preparation room with associated change room and material/equipment airlocks

The above is a brief overview of the project in question, more information will be provided at PQQ and subsequently ITT.

title: NHS North Kirklees CCG: Microsuction Service
description:
NHS North Kirklees CCG commissioners invite providers to the tender of Microsuction Service for the population of North Kirklees.

Across North Kirklees CCG, it is known that 1.3% of the population is currently accessing NHS ear wax removal services via ear irrigation. This cohort from a population (around 194,000) may benefit from micro suction. It is anticipated that with the implementation of the agreed clinical pathway and the NICE guidance as well as implementation of a locally delivered service the demand on secondary care services will reduce.

The service aims to meet the needs of people with hearing impairment associated with ear wax.

The overarching aims of the service are:

• To provide micro suction in primary care (GP practices) and the community.
• To provide general ear care advice and education and promote self- management prior to medical intervention.
• To improve the pathway of care for people with hearing loss by removing ear wax prior to any referral for audiology assessment.
• To provide equitable timely access to micro suction in primary care and community settings and reduce unnecessary referrals to secondary care.
• To ensure that micro-suction is appropriate, necessary, clinically correct, of high quality, with timely access
• To ensure equity of access across the CCG population.

NHS North Kirklees CCG intends to award a contract to the three highest scoring providers for this service.

The tariff for this service will be £35 for one ear, £60 for two ears. The activity for this service has been capped at 2,600 overall per annum

title: Modernisation of Five Passenger Lifts
description:
Bron Afon is seeking to appoint a suitably skilled and experienced Lift contractor to complete the modernisation of five passenger lifts at the following properties;

•	Fairview Court – 2 Passenger Lifts
•	Towers, Cwmbran - 2 Passenger Lifts
•	Monmouth House, Cwmbran– 1 Passenger Lift

The successful Lift Contractor will be required to deliver the modernisation    works to improve the condition and integrity of the motor rooms, lift shaft and lift cars as needed. This will also include any upgrade measures needed to ensure health & safety compliance, and any other relevant compliance requirements that Bron Afon are required to obtain.  

The modernisation works is to be delivered in line with an agreed phased plan, which aims to minimise the programme timeframe and disruption to tenants, as well as minimising risk and maintain service to our tenants.  

The successful Lift Contractor will be required to take on the role and responsibilities as principal contractor to deliver the scheme, and appoint specialist sub-contractors to deliver specialist works including any required building and structural works for example.   

The successful contractor will also be required to provide all service and  responsive maintenance requirements for 12 months following completion of the last lift, to include all break down and emergency call outs within set timescales.

title: Insurance for TQEC construction
description:
The University is seeking to procure insurances for the construction phase of the University's new campus: the Temple Quarter Enterprise Campus ("TQEC") adjacent to Bristol Temple Meads railway station.

The following types of insurance are required:
Delay in start up
Construction All Risks
Terrorism
Third Party Liability and Products Liability
Non-Negligent Liability
Financial loss

title: Rural Activity Garden Centre - New Barn
description:
The barn is to store and display vintage tractors and farm equipment. The barn has to look appropriate to the task, which is appear to be a simple agricultural barn. The building will not need to be heated in winter and will not have insulated floors, walls and roof. The work is limited to just the provision of the barn.

The site is in close proximity to a training centre for adults with learning difficulties; all health and safety planning must pay close attention to the schedule of works

title: Request for information (RFI) - Health Records Tracking / Filing Software
description:
Gateshead Health NHS Foundation Trust is looking to carry out a preliminary market engagement exercise to establish solutions that are currently available in the market place for Health Records Tracking / Filing Software.

In advance of any Procurement or mini competition/ direct call-off process under a previously procured Framework Agreement, the Trust intends to invite suppliers to participate in the following scoping exercise.

Please note, this exercise is not part of any pre-qualification or selection process. It is intended as an awareness, communication and information-gathering exercise, offering an opportunity for potential suppliers to provide information/present solutions to allow the Trust to inform future procurement strategies. 

The Trust invites providers to complete their RFI in the allocated time frame and return to the Trust via NHS Sourcing for information.

title: Heating Pipework Replacement Robert Clack Upper School Dagenham
description:
Heating Pipework renewal at Robert Clack Upper School Gosfield Road Dagenham

SITE
The site is located in Gosfield Road, Dagenham, Essex. It consists of a number of buildings. This project is applicable to the main school building only. The building is of three storey construction. Heating is supplied from a central plant which has been installed in the last 2 years.

OUTLINE SCOPE OF WORKS
The existing heating distribution pipework in the floor ducts located mainly under the corridor has reached the end of life and in some areas has failed and been locally repaired. The project works as described in the specification is to install all distribution pipework within the corridor and circulation space areas. The existing heating pipework in the floor ducts will be made redundant and remain in its current location. The new heating distribution pipework will connect to the boiler house primary pipework and rise to high level in the corridor in the close vicinity of the main plant room.
The new pipework installation shall be fully tested, commissioned and flushed prior to handover.

The anticipated tender period will be during May 2020. The ideal construction period (on site) would be during the school summer holiday period from late July to the end of August 2020, but due to the Coronavirus pandemic this may be subject to change. The work will proceed when the risk factors are considered to have reduced sufficiently. It maybe possible for works to be carried out during term time.

title: NHS Barnsley CCG - Children's & Young Persons Mental Health Service
description:
NHS Barnsley Clinical Commissioning Group (BCCG) is committed to a new approach to providing care for children and young people’s mental health. The new model will see an integration of the low-level and specialised support for children, young people, their families and the agencies that support them. This will remove barriers, reduce waiting times and create seamless care.  

In developing a Children and Young People’s Mental Health Service (CYPMHS), it is our intention to offer a single contract to an organisation(s) that will work closely with local services including GP practices and schools to deliver agreed outcomes. 

Please note that the estimated contract value below covers the 3 years plus the 2 year extension. The annual expenditure is estimated at £3,586,000.

title: #13336 - Innovation Station Design Contest
description:
Network Rail plans to run a Design Contest to seek innovative solutions in relation to two business challenges: Real-Time Platform Crowding Information and Smart Asset Monitoring. 

The Design Contest Notice will be released on 9th March 2020 and Network Rail is holding an industry day on 12th March 2020 to inform the market of the procurement event, provide further information on the challenges and discuss any clarifications. 

The industry day will take place on 12th March at the Science and Industry Museum, Liverpool Road,
Manchester M3 4FP. Arrivals at the industry day will begin from 12:00 and the day will conclude at 16:30. 

In order to register for the event, please follow the instructions at https://innovation-stations-industry-day.eventbrite.co.uk 

Attendees at the industry day is limited to 70 people and places will be secured on a first come first serve basis. Please note, individuals who are not able to attend the industry day will still have the opportunity to respond to the Design Contest Notice and all Q&A from the event will be published. 

In order to register for the Industry day individuals will not be required to register on the Network Rail procurement portal BravoNR, however when live, responses to the Innovation Station Design contest must be submitted via the BravoNR portal. Therefore, any participant wanting to submit a design proposal must have a registered BravoNR account (if they are not already registered). Participants can register by clicking on the following link and then follow the Register Now link within the Login box.

https://networkrail.bravosolution.co.uk

title: FS900075 Official Fish Inspectors eLearning Modules
description: This specification is for the content writing and technical development of an ‘Official Fish Inspectors’ e-learning course. The online training is primarily aimed at port health officers (PHOs) and environmental health officers (EHOs) training to become official fish inspectors (OFIs) in a port environment. Existing OFIs who may wish to refresh their knowledge also form part of the target audience.

title: UK Polycyclic Aromatic Hydrocarbon (PAH) Monitoring Network in the UK
description: The Environment Agency is looking for a Contractor to deliver and operate the UK Polycyclic Aromatic Hydrocarbon (PAH) Monitoring Network. The network provides United Kingdom wide national ambient air quality monitoring for PAHs. The Contractor will be expected to deliver various work packages involving preparing sample filters, managing the field monitoring, maintaining Agency sampling assets, reporting, sample submission, and submission of ratified site data results to the UK air website.

title: LBN - Youth Services Evaluation
description:
Youth Services Process Evaluation overview

1. To develop a Theory of Change model with young people, youth
workers and other relevant officers to identify the inputs and actions required to produce the desired impact and outcomes
2. To understand the effectiveness of the service expansion
3. To understand who is using youth services, and if so where, when and which services
4. To understand the barriers young people face in accessing the expanded youth service
5. To understand areas where improvements to the service could be made

Further details can be found within the tender documentation

title: The Servicing, Repair & Maintenance of Communal / Corporate Gas Installations
description:
The London Borough of Hillingdon (Hillingdon) currently manages and maintains the domestic gas installations of approximately 25 Communal plant rooms 63 corporate buildings at various locations across the borough. 
The objectives of this contract are to appoint one  service provider (contractor) to carry out the servicing, maintenance and remedial works to maintain London Borough of Hillingdon’s communal gas fired appliances, central heating and hot water system installations,  Solar PV, Air to Air Heat Source, CHP, Water Booster & Sewage Pumps in a legally compliant and serviceable condition and to the current Gas Safety, Installation and use Regulations and other relevant legislation that apply to Solar PV and Water Booster & Sewage pumps. 
The Council intends to award a contract for these services for a period of up to four (4) years with an option to extend for up to a further one (1) plus one (1) years subject to agreement and satisfactory performance. 
The proposed contract will be based upon the pricing schedule as shown in the tender pack and includes for the following;

TAB A - Communal / Corporate Gas Comprehensive Cover
TAB B - Air Source Heat pumps and Solar Panel Service Repair & Breakdown Cover
TAB C - Water Booster / Sewage Pumps Service Repair & Breakdown Cover
TAB D - Additional Works
TAB E - Percentage Mark Up (quoted works)

title: Lifecycle Cost Analysis (LCCA)
description:
The London Borough of Barking and Dagenham  is currently progressing 32 new build housing projects (appendix 1) which will deliver circa 3,000 new homes by 2025. These homes will be delivered across the borough comprising a mixture of houses and flats, in low-rise to high rise buildings. 

The current operational costs allowances (appendix 2) used for development viability purposes have been based on housing stock currently managed by the Council through its asset management company My Place. However, this includes older housing stock and is not tailored to modern, new build residential. 

The Council now require, through this commission, benchmarked target costs for all the operational costs likely to be incurred during the lifespan of these new build residential assets. These should include major repairs, cyclical renewal, maintenance and management/admin costs. These targets will sit alongside individual project lifecycle costs analysis, being undertaken by each project Quantity Surveyor.
buyer: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham

title: On Street Geo-Fencing Car Sharing Club
description:
Westminster City Council (the “Authority”) seeks expressions of interest for an on-street geo-fencing offering which would provide car sharing services open to all members of the public and will allow them upon registration, to book, hire and use vehicles which will be located on street within City of Westminster.

This is a new concept of car sharing in Westminster and vehicles will be based in geo-fenced locations and will not require fixed, marked up bays. Those using the vehicles will be required to return them to the same permitted area location to end their booking.



The permitted area within Westminster will be an area of streets with permission to park in pay to park, shared-use or resident parking bays. The permitted area will be determined as agreed between the borough and the car sharing operator.



The Concession of the contract will be for two years with an option to extend for up to two years in 12 month instalments, at the Authority’s discretion.

The Authority reserves the right to withdraw the process and pursue an alternative route to the market for the provision of the service should it deem it necessary.

title: Specialist Telecoms & Commercial Property Advisor
description:
The City of London Corporation (the City) invites Tenders for the provision of Specialist Telecoms & Commercial Property Advisor.
The City of London Corporation (COLC) is seeking to offer selected assets for the housing of mobile and wireless equipment to improve coverage and capacity in the Square Mile and to generate revenue under the Fundamental Review, with a total revenue target of £1m expected to be generated between 2020-2025.
The City is looking to appoint a Specialist Telecoms & Commercial Properties Advisor to enable the generation of new revenue from rental of rooftops on CoL buildings to mobile and wireless operators.
The duration of the contract is 5 years.

title: Supply and Maintenance of Blood Component Transportation Containers
description:
NHS Blood and Transplant (NHSBT) have transport container systems to transport blood components (red cells, platelets and frozen material) over both long and short distances. NHSBT requires a Framework Agreement by which they can purchase further transport containers along with a maintenance framework agreement to repair and replace their existing fleet.

The Authority invites Tender responses for the supply and maintenance of Blood Component Transportation Containers over a period of four years from the commencement date.

Beneficiaries of this framework agreement include Welsh Blood Service (WBS), Scottish National Blood Transfusion Service (SNBTS), Northern Ireland Blood Transfusion Service (NIBTS) and Irish Blood Transfusion Service (IBTS).

title: Develop National GIS Maps and Analyses of Accessible Natural Greenspace
description:
This contract aims to develop draft national open data maps and analyses of green infrastructure  (GI) and other social and economic data to enable stakeholders to assess their GI using the emerging National Framework of Green Infrastructure Standards, and identify how it could better deliver the aims in the Government’s 25 Year Environment Plan to connect people with the environment to improve health and wellbeing and to green our towns and cities.  

These maps are part of a support package being developed by Natural England and Defra for local authorities and other stakeholders to assess green infrastructure provision the emerging draft National Framework of GI standards, and are intended to help stakeholders to focus on areas where there is not enough green infrastructure (GI), particularly in the most deprived areas of England, and ensuring that new developments include accessible green spaces.

title: Air, Ferry, International Rail Booking Services
description:
The BBC is acting on its own, and on behalf of its commercial subsidiaries within BBC Commercial Holdings Limited, including BBC Studios, to conduct a competitive procurement with the intention of appointing one (1) Service Provider for the provision of - Air, Ferry, International Rail Booking Services.

The Service Provider will manage the end-to-end process of sourcing, booking and managing the BBC’s spend for air, ferry and international rail travel - as outlined within the tender documents.

The value of the contract covers the maximum total spend over the contracts term, including extensions - incorporating fares, fees to the Service Provider, in addition to the cost of bookings made by BBC Commercial Holdings Limited. It is not indicative of what the appointed Service Provider will be remunerated for their services, or what the BBC is committed to spend for air, ferry and international rail travel under the contract.

The value of spend for the contract, is expected to range between - £65,750,000 and £92,050,000.

title: Kitchen and Bathroom Replacement Programme Phase 4
description:
Kitchen & Bathroom Replacement Programme - Phase 4

Hillingdon Council is seeking a suitably experienced contractor to deliver (as the sole main-contractor) a programme of kitchen replacements and/or bathroom replacements over an agreed programme period for circa 50 occupied domestic dwellings in Hillingdon.

The proposed contract will be based upon a pre-determined basket of rates developed using the National Housing Maintenance Forum M3NHF Schedule of Rates version 6.3 including its long descriptions, the specifications of workmanship and materials and the relevant SOR rates for each element of the required works. The rates are to include for all preliminaries, overheads and profits. As part of their tender submission, contractors are required to tender a single percentage deduction adjustment to these basket rates as stipulated in the Phase 4 - Tender Costing Sheets and enter this adjustment into the Pricing Summary Sheet - K&B Programme Phase 4. 

The proposed contract will be for a period of approximately 10-15 weeks or as agreed with the successful Contractor.

title: Research into the Economic, Environmental and Social Opportunities
description: The Authority are seeking suppliers for Research into Economic, Environmental and Social Opportunities around options with scrap metal, particularly steel. Defra are seeking a researcher to research the economic, environmental and social issues and opportunities around options with scrap metal, particularly steel, including greater availability, reduced exports/ retained value, increased use in UK, the barriers to increased use, ways to overcome these, opportunities and implications for policy, including the benefits, costs and risks of any intervention and to make recommendations.

title: Secondary Blood Grouping and Sickle Testing
description:
NHSBT intends to undertake an OJEU tender exercise for a Managed Service Contract for the supply of secondary blood grouping and sickle cell screening systems. This must be fully automated as a secondary testing technology, for ABO and Rh D typing, antibody screening, extended red cell phenotyping and HbAS (heterozygous sickle cell trait) screening for donor blood samples.

See the Tender documentation for the full list of mandatory tests required.

The Managed Service Contract duration is for 5 years with the option to extend for two periods of 12 months.

title: Patient Mobility Products and Services
description:
HealthTrust Europe is seeking to establish a framework agreement for the supply of Patient Mobility Products and Services.

Lot 1 - Orthotic Products including but not limited to insoles, bespoke spinal braces and bespoke and ready-made footwear including surgical shoes

Lot 2 Prosthetic products including but not limited to, ready-made and bespoke artificial upper and lower limbs

Lot 3 Orthotic Services, including but not limited to the provision of an Orthotist to assess and prescribe for new and existing patients, including support services and patient after care.

Lot 4 Prosthetic Services, including but not limited to the provision of a Prosthetist to assess and prescribe for new and existing patients including support services and patient after care.

Lot 5 The supply of motorised, self-propelled, and attendant propelled and Wheelchairs and Specialist Seating

Lot 6 The Supply of Mobility Products, including but not limited to, walking frames, crutches, rollators

Lot 7 Wheelchair repair, modification and maintenance services

Lot 8 Wheelchair Services associated assessment, prescription, repair, modification and maintenance services including support services and patient after care.

Lot 9 The supply, repair, modification and maintenance of aids to daily living

Lot 10 Wye Valley NHS Trust requirement for a sole supplier to deliver an Orthotic Service and the provision of associated products

Tenderers will be expected to provide free of charge supporting elements such as training, education, clinical support, reporting and cost reduction initiatives.
buyer: HealthTrust Europe LLP (HTE) acting as agent for the University Hospitals of Coventry and Warwickshire NHS Trust (“UHCW”)

title: Framework for Supply, Delivery & Maintenance of a Range of Mobile Plant
description:
Antrim and Newtownabbey Borough Council would like to appoint contractors to a framework for the supply, delivery, and maintenance of a wide range of mobile plant and machinery for the period of 12 May 2020 – 30 May 2023 with the option to extend for up to 24 months, subject to performance and review.

The framework will include the following lots.

Lot 1 – Golf Course Machinery
Lot 2 – Mowers (e.g. Ride-on, Rotary, Cylinder, etc.)
Lot 3 – Small Tractors (up to 19HP)
Lot 4 – Medium Tractors (approx. 20 - 70HP)
Lot 5 – Large Tractors (above 70HP)
Lot 6 – Trailers 
Lot 7 – Diggers/Excavators
Lot 8 – Dumpers
Lot 9 – Utility Vehicles
Lot 10 – Towed/Trailed Items
Lot 11 – Other specialist equipment

title: SOCIAL HOUSING PROJECT CASHEL - CLOYNE NEWTOWNABBEY
description:
The Works will comprise the alteration and refurbishment of 2no. two storey buildings of traditional load-bearing construction into 3 dwellings. The Schedule of Accommodation includes: 1 no. 3P2B GN Apartment, 1 no. 2P2Bw Apartment and 1 no. 3P3B GN House.

 The works include partial demolition and removal of existing structures and sub-structures, hard-standing, walls, and site services.

title: Roofing Maintenance Programme 2020/2021 - Phase 1
description:
Name:
Proposed Planned Roofing Maintenance Programme 2020/2021 to Multiple addresses across the London Borough of Hillingdon.

Nature:
The works comprise a mixture of re-roofing, repairs and maintenance works to include, but not limited to, repointing chimney brickwork, fascias and gutters.

Location:
The sites located over seven separate site locations across the London Borough of Hillingdon as follows (Please also see Appendix A for list of property addresses).

• 3 to 37 Morgan Close, Northwood, HA6 3NE
• 14/16, 38 & 44 Wentworth Drive, Eastcote, Pinner, HA5 2PS
• Park Lodge, Taylors Meadow, Harefield, UB9 6LD
• 11 to 39 Milne Way, Harefield, UB9 6BQ
• 44 to 102 Albion Road, Hayes, Middlesex, UB3 2SP
• Rickards Close, West Drayton, UB7 7UX
• Attlee Road, Hayes, UB4 9JD

title: Clinical Waste Collection Service
description:
Tender opportunity 
To collect, twice weekly (usually Monday and Thursday) the clinical waste produced at Heathrow Animal Reception Centre (TW6 3JF) and to remove occasional sharps bins and dead body bins.
To provide clinical waste bags, lockable wheelie bin, sharps boxes and dead body bins as required
To comply with clinical waste regulations

title: In-home Usage data
description:
This tender is for the provision of in-home usage data and insight relating to eating habits within the home. 
Retail and Consumer Insight (RCI) team provides independent, impartial market analysis, using AHDB’s own, and third party information (upon permission with data providers). Our team’s aim is to describe and explain changes in consumer attitudes and behaviour enabling levy payers to better understand the market in which they operate. This helps farm businesses and other levy payer in the supply chain plan for the future and make better business decisions. 
As one element of our data sources AHDB purchases in-home consumption data to look at consumption behaviour in the home. The service is currently contracted to Kantar Worldpanel and is due to end in May 2020. This tender document provide an outline of AHDB requirements and the data requirement primarily fits with one of AHDB’s Strategic Priorities in helping the industry understand and deliver what consumers will trust and buy.
Contract Length: The tendered contract is for 3 years and intends to begin from 10th May 2020 with the option to extend for a further 3 periods of 12 months each after the initial three-year period.

title: Cefas: RFQ: Vessel Survey Severn Estuary 2020
description:
The BEEMS (British Energy Estuarine and Marine Studies) programme is funded by Cefas’ customer EDF Energy to provide authoritative scientific information on the marine and transitional waters in the vicinity of potential new build nuclear power stations.
Cefas has a requirement to conduct a survey to investigate the subtidal benthic communities in Bridgewater Bay. It includes six sampling stations: three located off Hinkley Point, and three located in the east side of the Bay (see map below). Three replicate grab samples will be taken at each site. This monitoring would serve to inform the WFD benthic invertebrate biological element for TraC waterbodies and it will also provide baseline data for the monitoring at Hinkley Point.

title: S1130 (2020) -Supply and Maintenance of Fleet Vehicles
description:
NIE Networks wishes to appoint suitably qualified and experienced service provider(s) for the  Supply and Maintenance of Fleet Vehicles throughout Northern Ireland. 
This requirement is split into lots as detailed below:

Lot 1 – Supply and Maintenance of Fleet Vehicles 
This lot is for all of the combined services from Lots 2 and 3 as detailed below.
Lot 2 – Supply of Fleet Vehicles
This lot includes the supply of vehicles on a fully managed service 
Lot 3 – Maintenance of Fleet Vehicles
This lot includes routine maintenance and inspection of vehicles on a fully managed service basis.

title: No First Night Out Tenancy Training Service
description:
No First Night Out (NFNO) is a rough sleeping prevention service working within the City of London Corporation’s homelessness team. It is a bi-borough project that works with clients who have a connection to the City of London and the London Borough of Tower Hamlets.

NFNO are looking for an organisation to provide pre-tenancy training for their clients whose pathways have been identified as accommodation in the private rented sector.

The chosen provider between March 2020 – March 2021 will work with up to 70 clients. The proposed budget for this work is based on a maximum spend of £12,000.

The duration of the contract is one (1) year, subject to the right of the City (at its sole discretion) to exercise its right to extend the Contract by up to one year. The maximum length of the contract is therefore two (2) years.

title: AHDB PR and Marketing representative for Japan
description:
AHDB Exports is looking for a Japanese, (Capacity for English) PR and Marketing Representative in Japan for British beef, pork, lamb and dairy products.
The successful representative will have the expertise and experience to identify the right priority market segments and ability to devise the best local strategy to achieve effective market growth.
Based and / or have commercial office in Japan– we will require evidence of this.

title: #13029 - Progressive vehicle geometry measurement
description: There is currently no robust method of in-situ measurement of vehicle component geometry for deformations in routine and post-accident maintenance procedures. Current methods require full vehicle strip and calibrated jigs to test vehicle geometry. title: Housing Mediation & Conflict/Complaints Resolution Service
description:
The City invites Quotations for the provision of HOUSING MEDIATION & CONFLICT/COMPLAINTS RESOLUTION SERVICE.

The Community & Children’s Services Department of the City of London wishes to commission an organisation experienced in mediation and conflict/complaints resolution to work with the Housing Division on the City’s thirteen social housing estates.

The duration of the contract is two (2) years, subject to the right of the City (at its sole discretion) to exercise its right to extend the Contract by up to one year. The maximum length of the contract is therefore three (3) years.  

Bidders must complete and return their tender using the capitalEsourcing portal (www.capitalesourcing.com).

title: Idling Action London Digital and Out of Home Advertising Campaign
description:
The City invites Quotations for the provision of Idling Action London Digital and Out of Home Advertising Campaign.

Idling Action London is looking to appoint a creative advertising agency to develop, produce and advise on strategically delivering a hard-hitting advertising campaign to support the project’s aims to reduce instances of unnecessary vehicle idling and hence reduce harmful air pollution levels. 

The contract will commence from early March 2020 and will end up to the 31st December 2022.

The estimated budget for this contract is £50,000.

title: #12592 - Training Modernisation -  Planning and Admin Solution
description:
Network Rail Training is evolving to meet the ever-increasing needs of our business. The technology that exists currently for the planning and administration of training courses does not adequately support the learning management process and is dependent on the use Microsoft Excel spreadsheets and Outlook mailboxes.  Consequently, Training Centres within the Routes operate non-standardised processes for the planning and administration of training, which creates unnecessary issues for other areas of the training support function and often leads to a poor learner experience.  The existing manual processes also increases the likelihood of human error occurring. 
Network Rail would like to implement software which manages the planning and administration of training to replace the use of spreadsheets and mailboxes.

The new system will be required to manage the following elements of the planning and administration process:
•	Course and delegate pre-requisites 
•	Course, trainer, location and equipment needs
•	Delegate joining instructions
•	Delegate approvals
•	Management information reports
•	Delegate swaps and cancellations
•	Updates to delegate learning records and competence
•	Integration with existing legacy systems

title: RM6134 Media Monitoring and Associated Services
description:
Crown Commercial Service (CCS), as the Authority, intends to put in place an agreement for the provision of
Media Monitoring and Associated Services to be utilised by Central Government Departments, all other UK
Public Sector Bodies, including Local Authorities, Health, Police, Fire and Rescue, Education and Devolved
Administrations. It is intended that this commercial agreement will be the recommended vehicle for all
Media Monitoring and Associated Services.
This agreement will be for the monitoring and analysis of media coverage to enable the evaluation of
communications campaigns. Associated additional services will also be included.
This is the replacement commercial agreement for RM3708.
This Framework will provide Buyers with services for the monitoring of specified keywords and topics
across multiple media types (including press, online, social and/or broadcast media), along with humandriven evaluation and analysis of the monitored media, as specified by individual Buyers.

title: GSMD Security Feasibility Study
description: The Guildhall School of Music and Drama (GSMD) wish to appoint a consultant to review the software, physical and business needs over all four of the GSMD sites and provide options for improving reliability, consistence and cohesion. The aim is a report that recommends how the delivery of a streamlined system that is robust (in order to support the varied expectations placed on the system across the organisation) can be achieved.

title: Kitchen and Bathroom Replacement Programme Phase 3
description:
Kitchen & Bathroom Replacement Programme - Phase 3

Hillingdon Council is seeking a suitably experienced contractor to deliver (as the sole main-contractor) a programme of kitchen replacements and/or bathroom replacements over an agreed programme period for circa 50 occupied domestic dwellings in Hillingdon.

The proposed contract will be based upon a pre-determined basket of rates developed using the National Housing Maintenance Forum M3NHF Schedule of Rates version 6.3 including its long descriptions, the specifications of workmanship and materials and the relevant SOR rates for each element of the required works. The rates are to include for all preliminaries, overheads and profits. As part of their tender submission, contractors are required to tender a single percentage deduction adjustment to these basket rates as stipulated in the Phase 3 - Tender Costing Sheets and enter this adjustment into the Pricing Summary Sheet - K&B Programme Phase 3. 

The proposed contract will be for a period of approximately 15-20 weeks as agreed with the successful Contractor.

title: DBS Checks
description:
NHS Digital requires a supplier to provide an on-demand electronic facility to enable basic Disclosure Barring Service (DBS) submissions to be sent to the DBS and processed in accordance and compliance with DBS requirements.

The supplier must be a Responsible Organisation registered with the DBS to submit basic checks through a web service meeting the standards of the DBS web services interchange agreement.

title: NHS Sheffield CCG - Cardiology Diagnostics (Ambulatory ECG) Services (AQP)
description:
The NHS supports improved access to diagnostic tests as part of the drive to reduce waiting times and improve choice options for patients. Community based diagnostic services are supported as part of a strategy to improve access to tests and ensure these tests are delivered at the right stage of the patient care pathway. 

The overarching aims of the Service are:
• To ensure patients receive the right test at the right time and in the most clinically appropriate local setting
• To ensure diagnostic testing is integrated across pathways of care, that the report follows the patient and that there is no unnecessary duplication of investigation
• To enable patients and referring clinicians to access a choice of provision according to patient choice, clinical need and relevant care pathway
• To ensure diagnostic tests are appropriate, necessary, clinically correct, of high quality, with timely access and reporting
• To develop local Service provision as part of a diagnostic commissioning plan which aims to improve access and choice for patients.

title: Innovative TB Diagnostics Research Project
description:
The Authority is looking for suppliers of proof of concept research into innovative Tb diagnostic tools.

The Authorities TB R&D programme’ is  launching a new scheme aimed at improving the bTB diagnostic tools available to our stakeholders. The scheme will use DEFRA budget to stimulate innovative TB diagnostic research projects up to 12 months in length, with a focus on proof of concept projects aimed at the development of diagnostic tools.

title: Birmingham Curzon Street Station Two - Stage, Design and Build Contract
description:
High Speed Two (HS2) Limited Phase One Stations Birmingham Curzon Street Station, Two-Stage, Design and Build Contract.

HS2 Ltd is seeking expressions of interest from suitably experienced organisations, with the capability of delivering a Two-Stage Design and Build Contract in a challenging and multi-stakeholder and dynamic urban environment.

The successful Two-Stage Design and Build Contractor will be incentivised under the Two-Stage Design and Build Contract to deliver Birmingham Curzon Street Station within budget and programme, including the design, construction, commissioning and handover into service of the station and associated Works and services whilst complying with all constraints and undertakings and working collaboratively with Others and Third Party Stakeholders.

HS2 Ltd intends to award a Contract in accordance with the Utilities Contracts Regulations 2016 (‘UCR 2016’) using the negotiated procedure with prior call for competition pursuant to UCR 2016, reg. 47.

The purpose of the pre-qualification process is to allow HS2 Ltd to assess the eligibility, economic and financial standing, and technical and professional ability of Applicants to perform the Contract in which they express interest and to select those Applicants who are to be invited to tender.

title: PHE_Scientific - Logistics Agency Contract in Ethiopia and Zambia
description:
PHE is seeking to partner with an Agency (Supplier) who can support the delivery of PHE objectives in Ethiopia (Lot 1) and / or Zambia (Lot 2). PHE has committed over the coming years (until 2021) to work with the federal government of Ethiopia and Zambia on International Health Regulations 2005 (IHR) compliance, as part of its IHR Strengthening Project.

The Supplier will work with PHE in Ethiopia and / or Zambia to deliver the project outputs described providing logistical support to complement the technical expertise provided by PHE. The Supplier will provide support PHE with logistical arrangements (e.g. organising national and regional travel, booking accommodation and events coordination and support). Please refer to the specification for further details.

title: Reprocessing/Recycling of Materials from MEA HRC's
description:
Tenders are invited for the provision of the Reprocessing of Materials as specified in this document for period commencing 1st April 2020 until 31st March 2021 with an option to extend the Contract for a maximum of three further periods of 12 months if agreed by all parties. Volume of waste is estimated and is for guidance only to aid in the tendering process. The volume cannot be guaranteed.

The Reprocessing of Materials from:
•	Waveney Road Household Recycling Centre, Ballymena 
•	Sullatober Household Recycling Centre, Carrickfergus
•	Redlands Household Recycling Centre, Larne
•	Glenarm Household Recycling Centre, Glenarm
•	Larne South Household Recycling Centre, Ballycarry
buyer: Mid and East Antrim Borough Council

title: Provision of a PCSP - Community Safety Wardens Scheme
description:
The PCSP wishes to appoint a suitably qualified individual or organisation to supply a Community Safety Wardens Scheme to impact on anti-social behaviour levels within Antrim and Newtownabbey Borough 2020-2022 through the delivery of an on-street presence.

Antrim and Newtownabbey PCSP invites you to consider these Terms of Reference to provide the information and support required to supply a Community Safety Wardens Scheme in Antrim and Newtownabbey Borough 2020-2022 to deliver a high visibility directed foot patrol service to discourage crime, low-level disorder, anti-social behaviour.

title: Prisoner and Non-Prisoner Fresh Bread and Morning Goods
description:
The Ministry of Justice requires a Contractor to provide the supply of Fresh Bread and Morning Goods to all public sector and inscope private sector prisons in England and Wales. This supply is critical to the prison service who feed over 80,000 prisoners as well as prison staff and visitors. The Contractor must be able to provide a core range of bread products and have the ability to deliver products on a national basis. Products must also comply with all relevant food safety legislation.
The number and location of prisons to which the Contractor shall be required to deliver may change to include additional prison sites as a result of the closure of some existing facilities and opening of new facilities. There may also be scope to deliver to prisons in Scotland.
The anticipated term of the contract will be 3 years from service commencement date (following an anticipated 3 month mobilisation period) with the option to extend (in accordance with the terms of the contract and at the Authority's discretion) for a period of 1 year.

title: Parsloes Primary School, Staff Room Extension, Alteration & Refurbishment
description:
Barking & Dagenham is undertaking a project at Parsloes Primary School to provide an enlarged and enhanced staff room. This consists of a single storey extension, to be built on to the existing staff room, extending into an inner courtyard. The existing staffroom will be remodelled and refurbished. In addition, there will be external works and landscaping to provide enclosed external spaces for staff use. Due to buildability issues with limited access to the courtyard, the design includes for timber frame construction with a view to minimising wet trades and allowing for craning materials and components into place.
The anticipated tender period will be from mid-January 2020 to mid-February, with a view to an earliest start on site in April 2020. The contract period would be nominated by the successful tenderer with a view to optimising construction costs, but also to minimising disruption to the school as work will be carried out during term times.
buyer: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham

title: NHS Doncaster CCG : Urgent and Emergency Care
description:
NHS Doncaster CCG currently commissions Urgent and Emergency Care (UEC) services across Doncaster. In 2015, four separate contracts were awarded for urgent and emergency care provision across: 
• Front Door Assessment Streaming Service
• Same Day Health Centre
• Urgent Treatment Centre including GP Out Of Hours (OOH)
• Emergency Care Practitioner services

The Doncaster UEC system has been strengthened significantly due to a “system” response to local challenges. The key to the local success has been partnership working with provider flexibility and adaptability. Over time, it has become clear that managing and delivering urgent and emergency care services needs to be undertaken as a whole, and that this is most effective through a contractual approach which drives integration and partnerships across providers

title: Strategy Development and Stakeholder Mapping
description:
Whilst LSBU has  been collaborating with local authorities, HE, FE and 3rd sector for many years on the delivery of a range of programmes with beneficial impacts for the economy and society, we believe we could be better at understanding, enhancing and promoting the full range of what we do and why it matters.  Therefore, we are seeking a consultant to help us build on this existing portfolio of work and support LSBU Group to:
•	 establish SLID h SBI as a key strategic partnership able to influence the design and delivery of the UK Shared Prosperity Fund  
•	support the development of an SBI   policy position with regard to the objectives, priorities and architecture of the UKSPF, based on the evidence of successful delivery of ESF and ERDF projects by LSBU Group and its partners  between 2014-2023. 
•	develop a funding strategy to ensure LSBU has a key role in the design and delivery of UK Shared Prosperity Fund as it is rolled out in late 2021.

title: Replace oak patio door and glazing at the Civic Centre, Uxbridge
description:
The London Borough of Hillingdon (LBofH) is seeking a contractor for the Replace the Oak Patio patio door and glazing to an office on the third floor of the Civic Centre. NB – The building is a listed building, so the new door must match the existing as far as is practicable.

SOR
• Carry out site visit to confirm requirement, location of windows and dimensions
• All dimensions/measurement are the tenderers own risk
• Template existing door, glazing bars, muntins and rails as required
• Off-site Manufacture of (English) oak door, similar to existing
• Polish door, frame and treat with Dulux Weathershield or similar for best match
• Remove existing door and hang new door on solid brass hinges, with brass lock and
• Provide new lock and brass lever handles
• Dispose of existing doors, frame and door furniture
• Glazing of the door to be included
• Dispose of all waste
• All installation works to be undertaken on Fridays, Saturdays and Sundays or at night.
• All site visits to be arranged beforehand
• No site visits to be undertaken without PM present
• RAMS to be shared before works commence
• Appropriate PPE to be worn

Prospective contractors should carry out a site visit before quoting.

title: Hernia Mesh, Fixation Devices and Accessories
description:
This Tender is to establish a Framework Agreement for the supply of Hernia Mesh Repair Accessories and Fixation Devices.
The duration of the Framework Agreement will be 4 years maximum; 2 years initial period with the option of extending for up to 24 months.
The tender is split as below:
•	Lot 1:  Synthetic Hernia Mesh: Non absorbable

•	Lot 2: Synthetics Hernia Mesh: Absorbable

•	Lot 3: Biological/Biosynthetics

•	Lot 4: Hernia Fixation Devices and Accessories

title: RBGKEW/815 Podcast Series
description:
We require a production company to research, interview, record and edit RBG Kew’s inaugural podcast series.
Ideally, this would be completed within a 3 month of window of being contracted, depending on availability of contributors. We have conducted research on story concepts and formats with a taster selection of podcast topics with real audiences. This research should drive the creative direction and production awarded in this contract. We have created a brief that will be shared on contract award.  We are looking for an experienced production crew with a portfolio of docu-series/storytelling podcasts to deliver this project

title: NHS Calderdale CCG: Improving Access to Psychological Therapies (AQP)
description:
NHS Calderdale CCG commissioners invites expressions of interest (EOI) from suitably qualified and experienced healthcare service providers including third sector organisations, social enterprise and other providers to provide Improving Access to Psychological Therapies (IAPT) services to people in Calderdale.

The IAPT service will be required to provide identification, assessment and treatment of adults (aged 18+) with common mental health disorders, in accordance with appropriate NICE guidance, with the aim of improving wellbeing and quality of life.

The commissioners encourage innovation and use of technology within service delivery. They are seeking patient centred solutions for the provision of this service with the following aims:
•	Early intervention and promotion of self-directed support and recovery
•	Provision of the least intrusive, most effective intervention first.
•	Development of the use of technology and digital platforms to engage patients who prefer this approach
•	Specific focus on increasing the number of older people and BAME people receiving treatment

In order to achieve the above aims and objectives the successful bidders should pay attention to following facets: 

•	Quality of provision
•	Equality of access 
•	Integration and coordination amongst various services to be provided under IAPT AQP
•	Sustainability 
•	Continuous Improvement
•	Value
•	Patient experience and positive outcomes

title: Handheld Solution - Ambulance Radio Programme
description:
The Ambulance Radio Programme (ARP) are conducting market engagement exercises to inform the scoping, approach to and content of the procurement for a handheld solution.

ARP would like to understand how experienced suppliers in the marketplace feel these requirements might best be met and is therefore carrying out a soft market testing exercise to engage in early informal dialogue prior to any formal procurement taking place. ARP are open to discussion on all potential models of service delivery.

Initial findings suggests that there are three core available delivery options, and ARP welcomes feedback on these.

Commercial off-the-shelf devices (COTS) – This is a possible option, but it is not believed that there is a COTS device available that fully meets ARP’s requirements.

Bespoke - Product development either through slight enhancements of current COTS devices or complete ground-up development

Dual mode – ESN and TETRA

We would also welcome options on how to accessorise a COTs device to meet the requirement in a single form factor.

Any information provided will be strictly confidential and non-binding.

This notice does not constitute a call for competition to procure any services, supplies or works for ARP, and ARP is not bound to accept any proposals offered.

If you are interested in participating in the soft market testing, please log in to Bravo Solutions to download and complete a non-disclosure agreement. A draft specification and request for information will then be shared.
buyer: Department of Health and Social Care

title: 20-08 in-situ testing stage for Bruker Skyscan 2211
description:
The University of Wolverhampton has been part funded by the European Regional Development Fund (ERDF) to deliver a Composites & Additive Layer Materials Engineering Research & Innovation Centre (CALMERIC) in the Marches, Stoke-on-Trent & Staffordshire and Greater Birmingham & Solihull Local Economic Partnership (LEP) areas.

The CALMERIC project supports SME’s to conduct collaborative research and innovation projects in the field of advanced engineering materials with specialist staff based in the Centre established on Telford Innovation Campus of the University of Wolverhampton. In order to compliment and add to the University’s facilities, the project requires an in-situ testing stage for Bruker Skyscan 2211.

All documentation available free of charge via BravoSolution, all submissions and correspondence via BravoSolution.

title: PHE - Corporate - Toolkit for Environmental Noise Burden of Disease
description:
Public Health England (PHE) is looking to engage with a professional body to:
i. Identify a robust evidence base that enables the accurate quantification of the health effects of noise; and
ii. develop calculation tools in Excel and R , and associated guidance, that will allow PHE to do burden of disease (BoD) and comparative risk assessments associated with environmental noise exposure at different spatial scales – from national/regional down to Lower Layer Super Output Area (LSOA)).

title: Provision of Public Affairs Support on Strategic Regeneration (A13)
description:
The London Borough of Barking and Dagenham has an ambitious strategy to lead, deliver and facilitate large scale regeneration in key areas of the borough over the next 20 years. Across each of these areas our focus is on shaping fantastic new places with the homes, jobs and infrastructure capable of creating vibrant and successful communities. This regeneration is a key plank of the council’s wider Inclusive Growth strategy.

As such we are looking to engage an organisation with a strong track record and the right capabilities to provide us with public affairs support on this strategic regeneration priorities. 

The tender document can be accessed at https://lbbd.bravosolution.co.uk/web/login.shtml. Bidders will need to register on the portal to access the tender documents and submit their bid latest by 12pm on 3rd April 2020.
buyer: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham

title: NHS Wakefield CCG Bereavement Service
description:
NHS Wakefield Clinical Commissioning Group (CCG) is seeking to procure the provision of bereavement support for the population of the Wakefield District offering a 3 year contract.  The Service is for those who have been closely affected by a death and require additional support in learning to live with their grief following bereavement.

The purpose of the Service is to ensure that timely and relevant one to one and group bereavement support is available to adults registered with a Wakefield General Practice (GP) who have been closely affected by a human death.  Furthermore the Service will be in a position to identify those at increased risk of, or currently experiencing a complex or prolonged grief reaction and support them to access appropriate services.
The Service will be provided by a number of trained bereavement support staff/volunteers who offer the following range of services:
•	Triage/Assessment
•	One to One bereavement support
•	Bereavement Support Groups
•	One to One Intensive Bereavement Support
•	Provision of information/Signposting

The Service Providers will need to work closely with other local agencies and services that have a role within the management of death within the community, particularly primary care teams.

This will be an open tender for a single service provider.

title: PROFESSIONAL CONSULTANTS FOR SOCIAL HOUSING PROJECT AT DEERPARK ANTRIM
description:
The site is located on the western side of the Dublin Road and is accessed from an existing laneway approximately 50 metres to the south of the junction between Dublin Road and Kirby’s Lane. The site comprises a triangular shaped plot of land, amounting to approximately 1.16 hectares, which was the site of the former Deerpark Hotel, which was demolished several years ago.

 The northern-western boundary of the application site is formed by a combination of substantial treeline and a wall in various state of repair. The existing laneway that provides access into the site runs along and within this boundary. The south-western boundary of the site is formed by post and wire fencing, as is the south-eastern boundary.

 There are a number of environmentally sensitive areas in close proximity to the application site.

 Clanmil expect to achieve approximately 37 units across the site with private amenity space and parking. The proposed mix could encompass:

• 7no 2 person, 1 bed General Needs apartments

• 10no 3 person, 2 bed General Needs apartments

• 12no 3 person, 2 bed General Needs house

• 7no 5 person, 3 bed General Needs house

• 1no 5 person, 3 bed Wheelchair Housing

 The exact mix will be determined through this competition. The properties will be constructed to Lifetime Homes and Secured by Design standards.

 Proposals should comply with the housing association guide and prevailing local and regional planning policy and guidance. 

 Please refer to the Department for Communities website below for design standards.

title: PROFESSIONAL CONSULTANTS FOR SOCIAL HOUSING PROJECT AT 64 ANDERSONTOWN RD
description:
The site is currently an area of overgrown disused land located c.4km to the southwest of Belfast City Centre in south Belfast. It is bounded by the Andersonstown Road to the north. To the south the site is bound by residential dwellings. The site is bound to the east and west by commercial premises (restaurants).

 Clanmil expect to achieve approximately 12 apartments across the site with private amenity space and parking. The proposed mix could encompass:

 10 x 2 Bed 3 Person CAT1 Apartments

 2 x 1 Bed 2 Person CAT1 Apartments

 The exact mix will be determined through this competition. The properties will be constructed to Lifetime Homes and Secured by Design standards.

 Proposals should comply with the housing association guide and prevailing local and regional planning policy and guidance. 

 Please refer to the Department for Communities website below for design standards.

title: Vehicle Relocations - Market Test
description:
Westminster city Council (“the Authority”) seeks expressions of Interest for a Vehicle Relocations Service within the Westminster City Council area. 

A dedicated relocation vehicle is required to be within WCC area waiting for deployment between the core hours of Monday - Saturday from 08:30am – 14:30pm. Outside these core hours, including Sundays and Bank Holidays, an on demand service is required 24 hours a day, 365 days a year, with a response time of 2 hours when request is received between 14:30pm and 18:30pm and 4 hours when request is received between 18:30pm and 08:30am.

The vehicles to be relocated would be relocated to the nearest available paid-for parking bay. The owner of the vehicles will be responsible for the payment of the pay-to-park bay and not the Service Provider

The Service Provider must have the capacity to provide at least three (3) relocation vehicles per day to cater for the dedicated relocation vehicle requirement and possible extra demands such as special events and other WCC departmental work requests and capable of carrying a parking marshal to assist with enforcement.
All Relocation Vehicles must be at least Euro 5 compliant, and of an appropriate size and capacity to be able to relocate motor vehicles up to a kerbside weight of 1,500cwt, as well as motorcycles, in a safe and secure manner from one location to another, within appropriate proximity within Westminster

The initial duration of the contract will be for 2 years with the option to extend up to a further 2 years, in 12 month instalments.

title: PHE - STEAM RESILIENCE PROJECT - REMOVAL OF REDUNDANT PIPEWORK AND REPLACEMENT
description: The works will involve reconfiguring and replacing the existing steam and condensate distribution systems in the main building wings (6no.) A key element of this task is that existing pipe (redundant and live) will need to be removed and disposed of. As much of this pipework is circa 1940’s, it is highly likely to contain asbestos debris throughout. Each wing will be a phase of work approximately 10 to 16 weeks and the project will be managed using the JCT Constructing Excellence collaborative contract with risk allocation.

title: 20-14 (2)  Deep Learning AI Server for Digital Enterprise Project
description:
The University of Wolverhampton has been part funded by the European Regional Development Fund (ERDF) to deliver a digital enterprise hub in the Marches (LEP) area. 
The Digital Enterprise project supports SME’s to conduct collaborative research and innovation projects in the field of AI, Cyber Security, data analytics, advanced engineering materials with specialist staff based in the Centre established on Telford Innovation Campus of the University of Wolverhampton.
In order to compliment and add to the University’s facilities, the project requires an AI & Deep Learning machine to support SMEs in the development of powerful algorithms and complex multi-layered Deep Neural Networks (DNN). These enable new directions within data processing and analysis and impact on fields like Big Data, image/language processing and recognition, machine translations and face/object recognition, security, social media and industry 4.0/IoT (Internet of Things).

title: Estimating Food and Drink Demand Elasticities
description: Defra previously undertook analysis to calculate food and drink demand elasticities in 2010/11 and is now looking to update and deepen evidence about how sensitive UK consumers food and drink purchases are to food price and income changes, including amongst different socio-economic groups.  The Department are looking to commission a study that considers long term and short term consumer responses to change in price and income, which will deliver new estimates of elasticities within a demand system, which covers the spectrum of food and drink household purchases, as defined in the current Family Food datasets or equivalent. The Department would also like to extend the demand system to include out of home consumption.

title: Cefas: BEEMS Sabellaria Survey 2020
description:
The BEEMS (British Energy Estuarine and Marine Studies) programme is funded by Cefas’ customer EDF Energy to provide authoritative scientific information on the marine and transitional waters in the vicinity of potential new build nuclear power stations. 

During infrastructure construction for the Hinkley point C power station, marine works will be undertaken in an area of Bridgwater Bay. Due to the proposed construction works an area totalling 9.7km2 will be surveyed to update existing habitat maps and identify potential Sabellaria reef habitats.

This opportunity is split into 5 Lots.

title: 20-07 Modernisation of a Dartec 20 kN Servo Hydraulic Test Frame
description:
The University of Wolverhampton has been part funded by the European Regional Development Fund (ERDF) to deliver a Composites & Additive Layer Materials Engineering Research & Innovation Centre (CALMERIC) in the Marches, Stoke-on-Trent & Staffordshire and Greater Birmingham & Solihull Local Economic Partnership (LEP) areas. 

The CALMERIC project supports SME’s to conduct collaborative research and innovation projects in the field of advanced engineering materials with specialist staff based in the Centre established on Telford Innovation Campus of the University of Wolverhampton. In order to compliment and add to the University’s facilities, the project requires modernisation of a Dartec Fatigue Testing rig located at the Telford campus.

All documentation available free of charge via BravoSolution, all submissions and correspondence via BravoSolution.

title: Support Services in Sierra Leone
description: LSHTM and its partners run clinical trials in Sierra Leone. To ensure that the research infrastructure is properly maintained and day to day operations can run smoothly, LSHTM wishes to award a contract to a single provider for a range of support services. These will include the provision of staff (primarily drivers), maintenance of vehicles and generators, bulk fuel management, in-country sourcing of non-clinical supplies and services, and importation support.
buyer: London School of Hygiene & Tropical Medicine

title: HPFT, HCT - Soft Facilities Management
description:
The Hertfordshire Partnership University NHS Foundation Trust (“HPFT”) and Hertfordshire Community NHS Trust (“HCT”) (the "Authorities") are jointly issuing this Selection Questionnaire ("SQ") in connection with the competitive procurement of soft Facilities Management (“FM”) services to both Trusts’ combined property portfolio.

The Authorities will evaluate the SQ responses from bidders (“Bidders”) and select between 5 and 8 highest ranking Bidders who will be issued with an invitation to tender ("ITT").

The preferred bidder will (subject to certain Trust specific variances) be awarded two identical soft FM service contracts, one with HPFT and the other with HCT. Both contracts will have a contract commencement date of 1 November 2020.

title: NE Casework Tracker
description:
Natural England (NE) is the government’s advisor on the natural environment. They provide practical advice, grounded in science, on how best to safeguard England’s natural wealth for the benefit of everyone. As part of their role is to provide advice which supports the planning system, as well as giving advice to landowners and occupiers wishing to carry out activities that may affect the natural environment. Terrestrial and Marine planning casework - for example: 
• Planning Application consultations
• Pre-Application Consultations and associated SSSI advice
• Development Plans
• Non-Statutory Information Requests
• Habitats Regulations and MCZ related consultations
• Environmental Permit and Marine License consultations
 Chargeable Service consultations – for example:
• Paid-for pre-application advice
 All Land Management Casework - for example:
• SSSI Assents
• SSSI Consents
• SSSI Enforcement/Environmental Damage
• EIA Agriculture
• Heather and Grass Burning

 Therefore, NE require an interactive web-based database tool, based closely on their current Casework Tracker system to track and report on a diverse range of casework. The successful supplier shall need to provide, hosting and maintenance of the system as well as providing additional un/scheduled system development change/improvements to allow for potential changing requirements.

 Start Date: circa June 2020 with a duration of 30 months (1 year +1 year + 6months)

title: Related Assets (Minor Works)
description:
Trivallis are seeking to appoint an experienced contractor, who has specific experience in dealing with reactive minor and access adaptations works as requested by task orders.

 It is the intention of Trivallis to appoint a single contractor to undertake the reactive minor access adaptations works. The minor works shall include, but not be limited to the following items;

 I. Handrails
 II. Grabrails
 III. Shower Seats
 IV. Galvanised external rails
 V. Widening Doors
 VI. Fencing
 VII. Half Steps

title: 20-06 Cancer Cell Sorter for SIRC
description:
Science in Industry Research Centre (SIRC) is an ERDF funded project that supports companies in the West Midlands to develop new science based products. Eligible applicants benefit from initial fully-funded support to refine their product concept and its development requirements (typically a minimum of 12 hours’ support from SIRC specialist staff).

The University is looking to purchase an easy to use fluorescence activated cell sorter/ flow cytometer that can help the cancer researchers at UoW to sort different populations of cells in a heterogenous tumour or use for routine analysis.

title: PEACE IV Consultants for Addressing Manifestations Works
description:
Antrim and Newtownabbey Borough Council (ANBC) is inviting a suitably qualified Lead Consultant to deliver the project detailed in the PQQ documents. The consultant team will be led by the identified consultant who will be the interface between the Client representative and all other consultant team members.

The remit of the service will include discipline input from, but not be limited to:
• Project Management
• Landscape Architecture
• Architecture
• Civil Engineering
• Structural Engineering
• Mechanical & Electrical Engineering
• Quantity Surveyor (Cost Consultancy)
• Principal Designer role under CDM 2016

Project Complexity

The project is made up of 8 separate sites located throughout the Borough, and involves a diversity of works. The project will also involve consultation with the main user group for each of the 8 facilities in design development.

title: PROFESSIONAL SERVICES FOR CONSTRUCTION PROJECT AT MOUNTPOTTINGER ROAD, BELFAST
description:
e subject site is located on Mountpottinger Road in the east of the City; more specifically
 the site is located within the Short Strand which is a working class / inner city area. The surrounding area is predominately residential in nature with a mix of former Housing Executive estates and new social housing developments. The site has easy access to Belfast City Centre, which is located approximately 1 mile west of the subject.

 It is proposed that the site will accommodate a new apartment development which will front directly onto Mountpottinger Road. 

 The site is positioned within proximity of the former Sirocco Works and is just a short walk from many of the local schools, amenities and leisure facilities.

 The subject is a small (0.25 acres) irregular shaped brownfield site which fronts directly onto Mountpottinger Road and is located directly adjacent to the Translink bus depot. The lands have been cleared of all previous buildings in order to facilitate development. Appendix 1 provides aerial image of site and site location map.

 Clanmil expect to achieve approximately 18 apartments across the site with private amenity space and parking. The proposed mix could encompass:

• 18no 3 person, 2 bed General Needs apartments

 The exact mix will be determined through this competition. The properties will be constructed to Lifetime Homes and Secured by Design standards.

 Proposals should comply with the housing association guide and prevailing local and regional planning policy and guidance. 

 Please refer to the Department for Communities website below for design standards.

title: Procurement of Criminal Defence Direct Services from 1 June 2020
description:
The Legal Aid Agency ("LAA") are inviting applicants who meet the minimum tender requirements to submit a tender for a Police Station Telephone Advice Contract (PSTA) 2020 to deliver CDD Services for 12 months from 1 June 2020 to 31 May 2021. The LAA requires two CDD providers. There is currently one CDD provider as the second has left the market and as a result we have decided to procure a contract with another provider to undertake part of the CDD Services

The LAA intends to award one (1) additional PSTA Contract. This procurement process is designed to evaluate an Applicant's suitability to contract with us. This opportunity opens on 30 January 2020. The deadline for submitting Tenders is 9am on 2 March 2020. 

You must read the Information for Applicants ("IFA") for this procurement process before submitting your Tender. ` The IFA can be found in the 'Attachments' section of 'itt_656 - Specialist Questionnaire for CDD Services from 1 June 2020' or can be downloaded from the Gov.uk website: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/criminal-defence-direct-services-from-june-2020 We will accept questions about this IFA up until 17:00 on 10 February 2020. 

Questions must be submitted through the relevant e-Tendering message board. Further information on how to submit a question can be found in the IFA.

title: WASH BAY FOR LBBD FLEET MANAGEMENT, WORKSHOP AND PASSENGER TRANSPORT
description:
We are seeking a contractor to replace the current wash bay system.

The Council has a range of vehicles and trailers which include those used for refuse, passenger transport buses, transits, trailers and a variety of plant. The Council has a total of 1000 fleet assets of which 400 are vehicles and the current wash bay is not large enough to wash all vehicles at the speed and time required. 
The current wash bay is not large enough to cope with the demand of the fleet. The upgraded wash bay system will include a new drainage system flowing into a new three stage interceptor reducing the maintenance being carried out. The wash system itself will be self-contained within its own storage unit utilising the space allowed. To feed the wash system a new self-banded fuel storage system will be added to the wash container.
buyer: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham

title: Motorway Service Area - Access Survey & Guide
description: The supplier shall undertake comprehensive access surveys of all Motorway Service Areas in England and make this information available to the public in easy to use and accessible ways, enabling disabled road-users to plan journeys on the strategic road network that meet their own specific access needs. The access guides should be accurately maintained and published for the duration of the contract, until March 2023.

title: INTERNAL CLEANING SERVICES & EXTERNAL WINDOW CLEANING FOR CONNSWATER HOMES
description:
Clanmil on behalf of Connswater Homes Ltd are seeking to appoint a suitably qualified cleaning and window cleaning contractor to deliver this service at sites across the east of Northern Ireland. The successful tenderer must be able to provide cleaning services and window cleaning services.

 WINDOW CLEANING
 Window cleaning, to include rooflights, velux windows etc. to each of the properties to all external windows and windows to internal communal areas once per two month period (unless otherwise stated) with no more than 60 calendar days between visits.

 INTERNAL CLEANING
 Internal cleaning to each of the properties to communal areas including but not limited to stairwells, staircases, entrance spaces, communal kitchens, communal toilets, office spaces, reception areas and meeting rooms.

title: ENHT - Water Hygiene Management
description:
The East and North Hertfordshire NHS Trust (ENHT) is seeking to appoint a suitably qualified and experienced supplier to undertake a comprehensive water hygiene management service.

The contract is offered for an initial 3 years, with the option to extend up to a further 2 years.

Due to the current COVID-19 situation, the Trust is not in a position to hold site visits. Site plans will be provided in due course, to enable prospective suppliers to submit their bids.

title: Future Potato Storage Research
description:
AHDB are undertaking a procurement for the Future Potato Storage Research Services.

These services consist of 6 individual Lots.
1.	CIPC Alternatives testing for fresh market storage
2.	CIPC Alternatives testing for processing market storage
3.	CO2 in sealed stores
4.	Maximum Residue Levels (MRLs) and Store Cleaning
5.	Variety testing – Dormancy
6.	Variety testing – Ethylene and temperature
Further detail of the Contract specification can be found at ITT Volume 2_Appendix A -  Specification of Requirements.

title: The Provision of  Financial Modelling and  Strategic Advice Services
description:
Westminster city Council (“the Authority”) seek expressions of Interest for Financial Modelling and Strategic Advice Services in support of their infrastructure projects. 
The services will cover:
•	Financial Modelling
•	Strategic Financial advice
Full details of the service requirements will be published with the tender. 
It should be noted that the EOI is not a guarantee of further competition.  The Authority reserves the right, at its own discretion, to withdraw from the process and pursue alternative routes to market for the provision of this service, should it decide to do so.
Expressions of Interest are not to be emailed directly and must go via the E-procurement portal capitalEsourcing.

title: Bats in Churches 2020, Church Management Plan, Design and Implementation
description:
The Authority is looking for Suppliers who will work closely with each of 35 churches to gather ecological and social information to help facilitate the planning and implementation of approaches to solving the conflict between bats and people at these most impacted churches.

 The work will involve significant time on site and will include meetings with Parochial Church Council (PCC) members, e.g. the Churchwardens and Church Architects.

 The supplier will use the ecological and social information they gather at the initial meetings and during ecological surveys to devise a range of options for reducing the impact of bats at the church. Parties will then choose the preferred approach to create a management plan.

 This will cover 35 Churches that have agreed to be part of this project, located within Midlands-Eastern-Southern England. These 35 have been grouped into one of 12 Lots, with Churches within each Lot selected by their proximity (where appropriate). There is a separate invite to tender for each Lot (linked to ITT_6785) and tenderers must clearly indicate which Lot they are bidding for. Each Lot will be awarded to the most economically advantages tender. There are no limits to the number of Lots to which any one tenderer can be awarded.

 This invite to tender (ITT 6785) covers qualification questions only to confirm eligibility of bids for each of the 12 Lots. The 12 Lots are covered by ITTs 6787 to 6798 inclusive.

title: MAIN CONTRACTOR LED TEAM FOR DESIGN & BUILD AT WATERLOO STREET, DERRY
description: Clanmil Housing Association Ltd (Clanmil) is inviting Contractors to carry out the design and build of social housing in an existing building at 50-52 Waterloo Street L’Derry, BT48 6HF as marked on the location map and folio maps included in the Appendices. The Contractor is to take possession of the building, ground floor and all upper floors and be fully responsible until completion. The Contractor is required to comply with the details set out in these Employer’s Requirements. The scheme already has Planning Permission. Arrangements to view the building during the tender period can be made by contacting Clanmil Housing Association.
